title: Variables & Constants
description: Learn about var, let, and basic data types
theory: In Swift, we use 'var' for variables that can change and 'let' for constants that cannot change. Variables are fundamental building blocks for storing data in your programs.
codeExample:
var name = "John"
let age = 25
name = "Jane"
// age = 26 // This would cause an error because age is a constant

title: Optionals
description: Understand optional values and safe unwrapping
theory: Optionals represent values that might be missing. We use ? after the type to declare an optional. You can safely unwrap optionals using if let or guard let.

challenge.instructions: Create an optional string called 'optionalEmail' with value nil. Then use if let to safely unwrap it and print a message.
